channel.title: math.OA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.OA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Jensen's inequality for partial traces in von Neumann algebras
item.description: arXiv:2507.02422v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Motivated by a recent result on finite-dimensional Hilbert spaces, we prove a Jensen's inequality for partial traces in semifinite von Neumann algebras. We also prove a similar inequality in the framework of general (non-tracial) von Neumann algebras.
item.dc:creator: Mizanur Rahaman, Lyudmila Turowska

item.title: Relative Generalized Boolean Dynamical System Algebras
item.description: arXiv:2507.02007v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study an algebraic analog of a C*-algebra associated to a generalized Boolean dynamical system which parallels the relation between graph C*-algebras and Leavitt path algebras. We prove that such algebras are Cuntz-Pimsner algebras and partial skew group rings and use these facts to prove a graded uniqueness theorem. We then describe the notion of a relative generalized Boolean dynamical system and generalize the graded uniqueness theorem to relative generalized Boolean dynamical system algebras. We use the graded uniqueness theorem to characterize the graded ideals of a relative generalized Boolean dynamical system algebra in terms of the underlying dynamical system. We prove that every generalized Boolean dynamical system algebra is Morita equivalent to an algebra associated to a generalized Boolean dynamical system with no singularities. Finally, we give an alternate characterization of the class of generalized Boolean dynamical system algebras that uses an underlying graph structure derived from Stone duality.
item.dc:creator: Allen Zhang

item.title: A Generalization of the B\"{o}ttcher-Wenzel inequality for three rectangular matrices
item.description: arXiv:2506.17365v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $m,n$ be positive integers. For all $m\times n$ complex matrices $A, C$ and an $n\times m$ matrix $B$, we define a generalized commutator as $ABC-CBA$. We estimate the Frobenius norm of it, and finally get the inequality, which is a generalization of the B\"{o}ttcher-Wenzel inequality. If $n=1$ or $m=1$, then the Frobenius norm of $ABC-CBA$ can be estimated with a tighter upper bound.
item.dc:creator: Motoyuki Nobori
